name: 4.20 "Save the Last Dance For Me" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: When did Diane start reading the "New York Times"?
questions.explanation:
age 4.

	She told Woody that she started reading the "New York Times" at 4 and then went on to the classics. She went on and on talking about herself to the point Woody got up and left.

The Boston Boppers.

	Carla and Nick used to dance with the Boston Boppers when they were younger. They were going to go to the dance together but they had a fight over who "carried" who.

questions.text: When did Diane tell Nick she thought about him?
questions.explanation:
flea and tick season.

	Nick has tried to woo Diane on more than one occasion much to the chagrin of Diane. He seems to have a way with women but Diane finds him utterly repulsive.

talent manager.

	Nick used to be a TV repairman but now his job is talent manager. He said he still does TV repair as a side job.

questions.text: Who did Carla get to replace Nick?
questions.explanation:
Eddie.

	Eddie was another good dancer so Carla thought with him she had a chance to beat Nick. Unfortunately, Eddie injured himself and couldn't dance. He was taken out on a stretcher.

questions.text: Who replaced the man that replaced Nick?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Diane told Sam that he was graceful. To Sam, graceful meant feminine so he did not want to be called graceful.

questions.text: How did the host of the dance contest start each show?
questions.explanation:
"Hi, kids."

	At the reunion he started off the same way he started every show with, "Hi, kids".  Carla told Sam this, and Sam was not very impressed.

questions.text: What did Nick and Carla used to do for good luck?
questions.explanation:
spit on each other's shoes.

	When Sam spit on Carla's shoes he missed. Carla said, "I hope you dance better than you spit."

questions.text: What's the first song they dance to?
questions.explanation:
"Tutti Fruitti".

	"Tutti Frutti" is Italian for "All Fruits". It was a song written and performed by Little Richard in the 50s.

questions.text: What song did Nick dance to with Carla?
questions.explanation:
"Unchained Melody".

	"Unchained Melody" was a song performed by The Righteous Brothers. After they dance to the song they are awarded the price which was $500 and a trip to Hawaii.
